summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary telephonic interview conducted on October 13, 2021, with a retired Regional Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019. The memorandum notes the interview was recorded and transcribed, and includes attachments such as the transcript, a BOP After Action Review, and an email from the date of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the OIG investigation. He was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Regional Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: The interviewee, a retired BOP Regional Director who had oversight of the MCC New York on the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead. Voluntarily interviewed by OIG agents regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.context: One of the OIG agents who conducted the voluntary telephonic interview of the retired BOP Regional Director.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York

events.title: OIG Interview of Retired BOP Regional Director

personsInvolved: Regional Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of an official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019.
A retired BOP Regional Director, who had oversight of the MCC New York on the day Epstein died, was voluntarily interviewed by OIG agents on October 13, 2021.

Attachments to the memorandum include the interview transcript, a BOP After Action Review concerning Epstein's death, and an email from the retired Regional Director to the MCC New York Warden dated August 10, 2019.
The memorandum explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
